summary: The document is an FBI record associated with the JFK assassination investigation, focusing on the arrest of William Sams for violating federal wagering tax laws at Ken Iron and Steel Company. It highlights the involvement of individuals with aliases, Gabrie Mannarino and Samuel Mannarino, in gambling operations in New Kensington, PA, and notes the subjects are considered armed and dangerous. Despite the raid, the gambling operations quickly resumed normal activities.
key_findings: The document is part of the FBI's records on the JFK assassination system.
It details the arrest of William Sams for violations related to federal wagering tax laws.
Mentions Gabrie Mannarino and Samuel Mannarino in connection with a gambling casino and horse room in New Kensington, PA.
The subjects involved are considered armed and dangerous.
The gambling operations were reported to have resumed normal operations shortly after the raid.
